titles.title: A bill to establish within the Office of Entrepreneurial Development of the Small Business Administration a training curriculum relating to businesses owned by older individuals, and for other purposes.
Golden-preneurship Act
Golden-preneurship Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Small Business and Entrepreneurship.

bill.summary:
Golden-preneurship Act
This bill establishes the Golden Entrepreneurs Training and Demonstration Curriculum within the Office of Entrepreneurial Development of the Small Business Administration to provide small businesses owned by individuals who are 60 years of age or older with tools to accelerate the growth of those businesses.
The bill also rescinds unobligated balances of amounts made available for the Community Navigator Pilot Program, which was an initiative designed to reduce barriers for underrepresented and underserved entrepreneurs in accessing small business support programs.
